pageProps.content:
If the contents of a website are written in a particular language, the visitors might be prompted to translate them into another language when using certain browsers ([Google Chrome](https://www.google.com/chrome), for example). You can prevent this from happening by setting the `translate` attribute for the whole document: ```html ``` The `translate` attribute has an effect on some translation tools such as [Google Translate](https://translate.google.com). Moreover, it's a global attribute meaning that we can use it for any elements. It's very useful if we don't want to translate a brand name even if the page is translated: ```html
(c) 2021 Brand Name
```
